results.name: Number of prime factors in the n-th multiply perfect number, counted with multiplicity: a(n) = bigomega(A007691(n)).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1600
mathematica: Select[Range[10^6], IntegerQ@ DivisorSigma[-1, #] &] (* or, using the b-file at A007691: *)
